thread.title: Local sports digest: Stanford men's soccer team rolls past Oregon State
thread.title_full: Local sports digest: Stanford men's soccer team rolls past Oregon State

author: Bay Area News Group
title: Local sports digest: Stanford men's soccer team rolls past Oregon State
text:
Local sports digest: Stanford men's soccer team rolls past Oregon State Bay Area News Group Posted: 10/11/2015 08:21:47 PM PDT Updated: 10/11/2015 10:36:16 PM PDT Amir Bashti scored his first collegiate goal at the close of the first half, Brandon Vincent and Foster Langsdorf added tallies in the second, and the No. 3 Stanford men's soccer team dominated No. 16 Oregon State in a 3-0 win at Cagan Stadium on Sunday. 
Stanford (9-1-1, 2-0-1) recorded its seventh shutout of the season and ran its unbeaten streak to 10 games. 
Cal played to a 0-0 draw with No. 17 Washington in Berkeley. Alex Mangels had three saves for the Bears (5-3-2, 0-1-2 Pac-12). 
San Jose State (4-7-0, 2-1-0 Western Athletic Conference) scored five goals in the second half en route to a 6-0 drubbing of visiting Grand Canyon University. Rory Knibbs scored twice for the Spartans. 
Cory Schmidt scored in the 70th minute to lift Saint Mary's (4-7-1) to a 1-0 victory over Pacific in Moraga in both teams' West Coast Conference opener. 
David Garrett's goal in the final minute gave USF a 2-1 win at Santa Clara in a WCC opener. Max Ornstil scored for the Broncos (5-7-0) on a penalty kick. Women's soccer Samantha Witteman scored her third game-winner of the season, and Cal (9-3-2, 3-2-0 Pac-12) beat Oregon State 1-0 at Edwards Stadium. 
Andi Sullivan headed in her team-leading fifth goal of the season in the 75th minute to lift No. 6 Stanford (11-2, 5-0 Pac-12) to a 1-0 victory against visiting Oregon. Advertisement 
Darriell Franklin and Dorthe Hoppius scored for San Jose State in a 2-0 win over Colorado College in Colorado Springs in a key Mountain West matchup. The Spartans improved to 7-5-2, 5-1-0. 
Saint Mary's (6-6-3, 1-2-1 WCC) took a season-high 25 shots but had to settle for a 1-1 tie against visiting Gonzaga. Hannah Diaz scored the Gaels' goal. 
Mariana Galvan scored her third double-overtime goal of the season and her second of the weekend to lift No. 25 Santa Clara (9-4-0, 2-1-0 WCC) to a 1-0 win over visiting Pepperdine. Tennis Cal's Maegan Manasse and Denise Starr won the doubles title at the Riviera/ITA Women's All-American Championships in Pacific Palisades, beating North Carolina's Hayley Carter and Whitney Kay 6-1, 6-4. 
Stanford sophomore Tom Fawcett's run at the Saint Francis ITA All-American Men's Championships in Tulsa, Oklahoma, ended with a 6-3, 6-2 loss to Virginia's Thai-Son Kwiatkowski in the semifinals. Cal's Andre Goransson also lost, 6-4, 6-4 to Tulane's Dominik Koepfer. Men's water polo No. 4 Cal defeated No. 3 Stanford 14-11 to place third in the Kap7 SoCal Invitational in Malibu.
